title: Leonardo Bonucci: Chelsea and Manchester City ready to return for Juventus ace following bust-up with Massimiliano Allegri
text:
Bon Appetit Leonardo Bonucci: Chelsea and Manchester City ready to return for Juventus ace following bust-up with Massimiliano Allegri 
Italian defensive superstar fined and left out of Champions League match against Porto to cast doubt on long-term future By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHELSEA and Manchester City are reportedly ready to return for Leonardo Bonucci following the Juventus star’s recent bust-up with boss Massimiliano Allegri. 
The English duo were desperate to sign Bonucci last summer as they plotted their paths towards Premier League dominance. EPA 5 Chelsea and Man City are reportedly ready to revive their interest in Leonardo Bonucci 
But the Italian superstar opted to stay in Turin and ended up penning a new five-year contract in December. Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
A touchline argument saw the 29-year-old receive a fine and he has also been dropped for tonight’s Champions League clash against Porto . Getty Images The defender’s Juventus future is under the spotlight following a bust-up with his boss Has Leonardo Bonucci won the title of worst dive ever? Getty Images 5 Antonio Conte is keen for a reunion after managing Bonucci as Juve and Italy boss 
Bonucci remains a key player for Juventus but Gazzetta dello Sport claims he will now consider his future in the wake of the incident. 
And that’s prompting fresh interest from Chelsea and Man City , who are ready to offer the Italy international a second bite of the Premier League cherry. Related Articles Manchester United would join elite group of giant clubs with Europa League success London Calling Everton star Romelu Lukaku drops not-too-subtle hint at Chelsea return with Champions League tweet Get shirty Man City fan pretends to be a steward to get hold of Kevin de Bruyne’s shirt after Monaco thriller… then gets chased off pitch by real stewards Pep's Jet Setters Manchester City fly out to Abu Dhabi for training camp straight after dramatic Champions League win over Monaco EPA City claim Bonucci claim close to linking up with Pep Guardiola last summer Getty Images 5 Bonucci is said to be considering his future despite signing a five-year deal in December 
The Blues were lining up a January bid for Bonucci before he signed his contract extension, and their position in the table could convince him to link up with Antonio Conte at Stamford Bridge. 
But City claimed in October that Bonucci was keen to work with Pep Guardiola , and he could yet take up a big-money offer at the Etihad.
